intro: Campylandra delavayi, commonly known as the Delavay's campylandra, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of western China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure species in botanical gardens.
